title: TV best bets: Sun., Oct. 25
text:
TV best bets: Sun., Oct. 25 October 25, 2015 Last updated: Sunday, October 25, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record Buy this photo Neil deGrasse Tyson hosts "StarTalk" at 11 p.m. on the National Geographic channel. 
8 p.m., CBS: Madam Secretary — The schism between Elizabeth (Tea Leoni) and President Dalton (Keith Carradine) widens when she disagrees with his response to escalating tensions with Russia and subsequently finds herself pushed out of the inner circle. Nor are things better on the home front, where Elizabeth and Henry (Tim Daly) struggle to protect reckless daughter Stevie (Wallis Currie-Wood) from the media after incriminating photos of her with first son Harrison Dalton come to light in the new "Waiting for Taleju." 
8 p.m., FOX: The Simpsons — In this season’s typically surreal Halloween special "Treehouse of Horror XXVI," Sideshow Bob (voice of Kelsey Grammer) finally makes good on his oft-repeated threat to kill Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright), then proceeds to reanimate the corpse. 
9 p.m., ABC: Blood & Oil — In the new episode "Rocks and Hard Places," Wick’s (Scott Michael Foster) inadequacies become more apparent when Lacey (Miranda Rae Mayo), his sister and potential rival, joins the family business. Billy (Chace Crawford) tries to blackmail Hap (Don Johnson) using information Cody (Rebecca Rittenouse) shared with him in confidence, further testing their marriage. 
10 p.m., HBO: Project Greenlight — With the stress level already sky-high on the final day of shooting at the house, the production team grows increasingly frustrated that Jason has yet to select a location for the car-crash scene in a new episode titled "Accident Waiting to Happen." 
11 p.m., NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC CHANNEL: StarTalk — Neil deGrasse Tyson returns for a second season of smart, provocative conversation, starting tonight with former President Bill Clinton. In the course of their chat, Clinton opens up on topics such as the importance of having a shared appreciation of science in our culture, ways to use the cosmos to solve problems in the Oval Office and even the touchy subject of Pluto’s demotion to "dwarf planet" status. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
